text: twenty-nine percent of americans say they'd carry a smartcard that stores personal data, including fingerprints and bank information (market & opinion research international)  ... thirty-six percent of americans would be willing to do their banking with microsoft as an alternative to established financial institutions, 28 percent with coca-cola (market & opinion research international) ... european companies will spend up to $400 billion upgrading computers to handle the switch to the euro (gartnergroup) ... over the next decade, business will outspend government on computer equipment nearly 12 to 1 (bureau of labor statistics) ... twenty percent of us taxpayers filed their returns electronically in 1997; the irs expects that figure to reach 80 percent by 2007 (irs) ... last year, more than 90 percent of political-campaign volunteers who signed up online did so proactively; 55 percent of them had never volunteered politically before (gopac; hockaday donatelli/campaign solutions) ... sixty-one percent of electric-utility customers in the us are unaware that due to deregulation they may now be able to choose another provider (market facts) ... if stranded on a desert island and forced to choose, two-thirds of net users would rather have online access than a phone or tv (roper starch worldwide) ... one in three adult americans begins each net experience through an aol-owned portal (cyber dialogue) ... forty-five percent of us computer owners don't know their modem speed (maritz ameripoll)must readfight!quick, hide your moneyconfronting e-griefjargon watchhere comes the sluggerinsta-money hits the webhype listgoing, going, againpeoplehome(page) schoolingtomorrow todaymcservice providerswhat stuff is made ofthe taste of 2000cool battles, circa 300 bctired/wiredvery local loopraw data
